page.title: 01Tuffley,Quedgeley & Whaddon.
page.content: Being part of the Vale of Gloucester, on the east bank of the River Severn, much of the area is flat, but 4km from the river is Robinswood Hill, which rises sharply to 630ft. Tuffley forms the southern extremity of Gloucester, and much of it was developed between the late 1950's and the 1970's. It has a popular residential area, well served with shops, schools, churches, medical services, recreational facilities and bus services. Until the 1970's Quedgeley was a quiet Severn-side village. Rapid development has transformed it into a vast residential area, but still outside the city. Tiny Whaddon, however, has remained unaffected by such changes so far.
